attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
+ Physical stock count was done on 16.02.2025 @6am.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -83 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +14 pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: + The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.

value: + More improvement measures will be initiated.
+ Control is ok and will maintain the trend.

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 16.02.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.

+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

+ The company is not exposed to item loss.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Raw materials weight analysis.
attributes.description:
+ 10bags of White flour (50kg) and 10bags of white ingredients (9kg) were weighed on 16.02.205.

+ Average white flour weight was 50.38kg while white ingredients average weight was 9.4kg.

+ Hence raw material weights showed compliance.
attributes.recommendation: + Raw materials have desired weights is commendable and ensures standard bread weight production.

value: + Raw materials had desired weights.
+ I always direct supervisors to randomly weigh raw materials upon receipt.
+ Raw material weights were sampled to ensure that their weights complied to stipulated weights.
+ Adherence of raw materials to set weights ensures quality and standard bread weight production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring raw material weights complied to those stipulated.

attributes.title: Dough Weights Analysis.
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set dough dividing weights is commendable.

value: + We will ensure desired dough dividing weights are maintained.
+ Set standard dough dividing weights will always be adhered to.
+ Dough weights were randomly sampled to check compliance.
+ Adherence to stipulated dough dividing weights implies standard weight bread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Sampling of dough sample weights to ensure compliance to set standard weights.

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
+ packed bread weights were sampled on 16.02.25.

+ Both overweight and underweight loaves were noted with the weight extreme rates exceeding 10%.

·         Bread weights were sampled on 16/02/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

+ Noted high overweight and underweight bread rate should be addressed.

value: + Noted bread weights both over and underweights will be closely monitored and addressed.

+ We will continue sensitizing dough dividers on the importance of adhering to standard dough dividing weights as this would address over and underweight bread.

+ Packing process will also be closely monitored to ensure that packing cycle is adhered to in order to avoid overcooling of bread.
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+  Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency during dough dividing.

+ Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

+ High overweight bread on the other end deprives the company revenues because this lowers expected yields.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring packed bread weights comply with stipulated standard weights

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/01/2025 - 15/02/2025.

  • Production damage rate was observed to be high than the allowed.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

+ The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high production damages.
+ Noted high production damages will be addressed.

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

+ Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Physical cash verification.
attributes.description:
·           Physical cash was verified on 17/02/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

+ Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.

value: - Proper cash control will be maintained.
+ This trend will be maintained.
+ Physical cash was verified on 17/02/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
+ Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
+Ensuring strong cash controls.

attributes.title: Raw material set standard consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Manual mixing charts were analyzed from 01.01.25 - 15.02.25 to check the quantity of raw materials consumed and these were compared to set standard consumption quantities on SAP system.

Below are the summary of the findings

01/01/2025 – 31/01/2025

                                         01/02/25 – 15.02.2025

·          The above tables shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
• We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers.
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.01.25 – 15.02.25 to find out if accurate transfer of consumption quantities data was being done.
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard raw material consumption quantities are adhered to.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 17.02.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.

value: + We shall maintain control at the mini shop.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+  A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Mini shop SOPs are followed.
Sales Department
+ To ensure that all bread loaded at the mini shop is well accounted for and mini shop SOPs are strictly adhered to.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
+Mixing chart (manual) yields were computed per variety and compared with those of SAP (which has set yields) form 01.01.25 - 15.02.25.

+ Resulting yields for mixing charts matched those of SAP system. The tables below more details of the same.

FROM 01.01 - 31.01.25

FROM 01.02 - 15.02.25
attributes.recommendation: + Matching of manual mixing chart yields with those set on BOM and reflected on SAP system is commendable.  This is encouraged in future.

value: + We will maintain this trend.
+ Expected yields are always a priority during production.
+ Analysis of yield registers to check if desired yields were realized and reflected on relevant documents.
+ All bread produced was properly accounted for.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Production efficiency was analyzed from 01.01.25 - 15.02.25.

+ Production efficiency was noted. Resulting efficiency was 4.62bags/staff (01.01.25 - 31.01.25) and 4.66bags/staff (01.02.25 - 15.02.25)

PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 01/01/2025 - 15/02/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + Branch management should ensure observed proper planning is maintained.

value: + We will continue adhering to set operational efficiencies and even improve on the same.
+ Adherence to set operational efficiencies will be maintained.

+ This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

+ Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Adherence to set operational efficiencies checked production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set production efficiencies are adhered to.

attributes.title: Motor Vehicle Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
+ Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/01/2025 – 31/01/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table.

+ Fuel consumption for all vans was found to be within the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: + Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+ We will maintain the observed trend.

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans and generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Generator fuel consumption was analyzed from 01.01.25 - 17.02.25. This was analyzed as per table below.

GENERATOR : (01/01/25 - 17/02/25)

·           Set standard fuel consumption for the generator was not provided.
attributes.recommendation: + Fuel consumption controls for the generator are commendable.

value: + We purchase and drain fuel into the generator as per instruction from personnel monitoring the probe system.

+ We always purchase generator fuel upon requesting for the quantity to purchase from personnel monitoring the probe system.

+ Purchased fuel is all drained into the generator upon purchasing.

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by s and generator was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel controls noted check operation costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring economical fuel consumption by the generator.
